verses.roman:
sa mukto 'strāgni-tāpena
durvāsāḥ svastimāṁs tataḥ
praśaśaṁsa tam urvīśaṁ
yuñjānaḥ paramāśiṣaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—he, Durvāsā Muni; muktaḥ—being freed; astra-agni-tāpena—from the heat of the fire of the Sudarśana cakra; durvāsāḥ—the great mystic Durvāsā; svastimān—fully satisfied, relieved of the burning; tataḥ—then; praśaśaṁsa—offered praise; tam—unto him; urvī-īśam—the King; yuñjānaḥ—performing; parama-āśiṣaḥ—the highest benedictions.
translation: Durvāsā Muni, the greatly powerful mystic, was indeed satisfied when freed from the fire of the Sudarśana cakra. Thus he praised the qualities of Mahārāja Ambarīṣa and offered him the highest benedictions.
